subject: Re: [junit] how many tests on a method - all possible scenarios or just enough?
msgSnippet: ... The method in question is not cohesive. If you wrote it, I would suggest starting over. Ron Jeffries www.XProgramming.com Sometimes, the best applause lies
messageBody:
On Friday, November 14, 2003, at 9:13:58 AM, Kevin O'Sullivan wrote:

>>>Yes, it does. Quick question. How many lines does that method have?
> About 200. And to complicate things it calls a private method of about
> 200 lines.

The method in question is not cohesive. If you wrote it, I would suggest
starting over.

Ron Jeffries
www.XProgramming.com
Sometimes, the best applause lies in knowing you have offended a fool.
-- Anonymous
